newsitem.title: UK: UK govt receives PFI review, decision on June 23.
newsitem.headline: UK govt receives PFI review, decision on June 23.

text.p: The UK Paymaster General, Geoffrey Robinson, said on Friday he had received the private finance initiative (PFI) review commissioned just after Labour's election victory last month and planned to announce his final changes on June 23.

Robinson pledged to revamp PFI, designed to attract private capital into public infrastructure projects, within days of the new government taking power. Robinson said the review will be examined before he presents his final plans at a press conference later this month.

"I promised swift, decisive action to re-invigorate the Private Finance Initiative and that is exactly what I will deliver. This report from Malcolm Bates will not sit on the shelf. I will publish the conclusions and announce my decisions in less than two weeks. We do not let the grass grow under our feet here," he said.

The review was commissioned to be carried out by Malcolm Bates on May 8. The PFI initiative has faced severe criticism from UK construction companies and their financiers for its delays, red tape and heavy bidding costs.
